title: 15x regression in 0-change build time for torch C++ files.
body_html:
When debugging the C++ files in torch, to get consistent debugging signal, we need to always rebuild before running the python tests. Previously because torch files were all building in the develop phase, a non-changed build would take ~1 second, making it easy to run it all the time.

Now that some but not all files have moved into the build phase, non-changed builds take 15 seconds, a 15x slowdown that makes it impractical to consistently re-build.

We need to improve the non-changed speed of the build phase for this to be an acceptable dev situation.

@anderspapitto @ezyang

body:
When debugging the C++ files in torch, to get consistent debugging signal, we need to _always_ rebuild before running the python tests. Previously because torch files were all building in the `develop` phase, a non-changed build would take ~1 second, making it easy to run it all the time.

Now that some _but not all_ files have moved into the `build` phase, non-changed builds take 15 seconds, a 15x slowdown that makes it impractical to consistently re-build.

We need to improve the non-changed speed of the build phase for this to be an acceptable dev situation.

@anderspapitto @ezyang
